citation.article-title: Phylogenetic analysis of Alloiococcus otitis gen. nov., sp. nov., an organism from human middle ear fluid.

p.s: Alloiococcus (Al.loi.o.coc'cus. Gr. adj. alloios, different; N.L. n. coccus, coccus; Alloiococcus, different coccus, referring to the phylogenetic distinctiveness of the organism)
Cells are ovoid and occur mostly in pairs or tetrads.
Cells are gram positive and nonsporeforming.
Grows at 45Â°C, in the presence of 6.5% NaCl, and on bile esculin agar.
Acid is not produced from glucose and other sugars.
The DNA base composition is 44 to 45 mol% G+C.
The type species is Alloiococcus otitis.
